subject: Re: Running tests multiple times w/ different config
msgSnippet: JUnit 4 actually has a Parameterized custom test runner that allows you to run the same test(s) with different parameters.  Take a look at
messageBody:
JUnit 4 actually has a Parameterized custom test runner that allows
you to run the same test(s) with different parameters. Take a look at
org.junit.runners.Parameterized in the JUnit Javadoc.

I've been working on an "XML" version of Parameterized that allows you
to store your test parameters in an XML file. It's part of the
JunitExt project (http://www.junitext.org). I must warn you that it's
still in the early stages of development.

However, it sounds like using Parameterized might be easier than my
XMLParameterizedRunner, as you'll likely need to do something
programatically with Hibernate.

The nice thing about custom test runners is that they work with IDEs.
For example, you can use Parameterized and still be able to run the
tests from within Eclipse.

-Jim Hurne
